alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Boise and southeastern Gem Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sweet, or 8 miles northeast of Emmett, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Horseshoe Bend, Gardena, Sweet and Montour. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
